briefdescription.para: These are the frame IDs that define the kind of data we acquiere from the CAN bus.
This is the pointer to the can bus to communicate with.
measurement_ contains all the measurements acquiered from the CAN board.
This is the status history of the CAN board.
This is the buffer of the controls to be sent to card.
This is the buffer of the commands to be sent to the card.
This is the history of the already sent controls.
This is the history of the already sent commands.
This boolean makes sure that the loop is stopped upon destruction of this object.

This variables if true means two things: Are motor in idle mode = 0 torques?, and is the timeout duration for a control signal zero on the TI board? When a new control is sent the motors will enter into their normal state where they are active with the proper timeout duration.
Is the system in safemode? This implies the motors were killed and now being held constant at 0 control magnitude. This is maintained until reset.
If no control is sent for more than control_timeout_ms_ the board will shut down.
This is the thread object that allow to spwan a real-time thread or not dependening on the current OS.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::shared_ptr< CanBusInterface > can_bus, const size_t &history_length=1000, const int &control_timeout_ms=100)
memberdef.name: CanBusControlBoards

briefdescription.para: Construct a new CanBusControlBoards object.
Destroy the CanBusControlBoards object.
Get the measurement data.

Getters
index
is the kind of measurement we are insterested in.
Ptr<const ScalarTimeseries> is the list of the last measurements acquiered from the CAN card.

briefdescription.para: Get the status of the CAN card.

parameterdescription.para: the kind of status we are interested in.

simplesect.para: Ptr<const StatusTimeseries> is the list of last acquiered status.

briefdescription.para: Get the controls to be sent.

parameterdescription.para: the kind of control we are interested in.

simplesect.para: Ptr<const ScalarTimeseries> is the list of the control to be sent.

briefdescription.para: Get the commands to be sent.

simplesect.para: Ptr<const CommandTimeseries> is the list of the command to be sent.

briefdescription.para: Get the already sent controls.

parameterdescription.para: the kind of control we are interested in.

simplesect.para: Ptr<const ScalarTimeseries> is the list of the sent cotnrols.

briefdescription.para: Get the already sent commands.

simplesect.para: Ptr<const CommandTimeseries> is the list of the sent cotnrols.

briefdescription.para: Set a board to an active state if it is not already active. This means the board will now have its status checked for is_ready and if the board is the motor_board we must send enable the motors etc.
Set the controls, see ControlBoardsInterface::set_control.
Set the commands, see ControlBoardsInterface::set_command.
Send the actual command and controls.
returns only once board and motors are ready.

detaileddescription.para: This will cause the control to reset the "safemode" if the control is currently in safemode. Additionally the motors will be paused and The control boards will be reset such that any timed out connection will be reestablished.
This will cause the control to be forced into a "safemode" where the control is set to zero then held constant until reset.
This will return if the control is in "safemode".

briefdescription.para: True if all active boards have established at least one status message from the board that does not include any error.
Sets motors to Idle and sets the canbus control recieve timeout on board to none until next action is sent.
Disable the can reciever timeout.

parameterdescription.para: this is the type of the bytes convert.

simplesect.para: int32_t the output integer in int32.

briefdescription.para: Convert from 24-bit normalized fixed-point to float.
Converts from float to 24-bit normalized fixed-point.
Converts from qbytes to float.

parameterdescription.para: the type of byte to manage

briefdescription.para: send the controls to the cards.

parameterdescription.para: are the controls to be sent.

briefdescription.para: send the latest commands to the cards.
Is the loop that constently communicate with the network.
Display details of this object.
This is the helper function used for spawning the real time thread.

parameterdescription.para: is the current object in this case.

simplesect.para: THREAD_FUNCTION_RETURN_TYPE depends on the current OS.

briefdescription.para: This class CanBusControlBoards implements a ControlBoardsInterface specific to CAN networks.
